intro: Dendranthema indicum, commonly known as the common chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–150 cm and features hairy stems and lobed leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental garden plant. Dendranthema indicum is also valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
